def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # Shoot the first zombie
    ammo -= 1
    shot += 1
    
    # Check if all zombies have been shot
    if shot == zombies:
        return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."
    
    # Check if there are no more bullets
    if ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
    
    # Move the remaining zombies forward
    distance -= 0.5 * (zombies - shot)
    
    # Check if any zombies have reached you
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    
    # Recursively call the function with updated parameters
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):

    # Shoot one zombie
    shot += 1
    ammo -= 1

    # Check if all zombies are shot
    if shot == zombies:
        return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."

    # Check if out of ammo
    if ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

    # Move remaining zombies closer
    distance -= 0.5

    # Check if zombies reach 0 distance
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

    # Recursively call the function
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # Shoot one zombie
    shot += 1
    zombies -= 1

    # Check if all zombies are shot
    if zombies == 0:
        return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."

    # Move zombies closer
    distance -= 0.5

    # Check if distance reached 0
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

    # Check if out of ammo
    if ammo == 1:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

    # Reduce ammo count
    ammo -= 1

    # Recursive call
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # While there are still zombies and ammo left
    while zombies > 0 and ammo > 0:
        # Shoot one zombie
        zombies -= 1
        # Decrease the distance by 0.5 meters
        distance -= 0.5
        # Increase the shot counter by 1
        shot += 1
    # If all zombies are shot
    if zombies == 0:
        return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."
    # If there are still zombies and no ammo left
    elif zombies > 0 and ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
    # If there are no zombies left and ammo is still available
    elif zombies == 0 and ammo > 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    # If there are still zombies and no ammo left, but distance is 0
    elif zombies > 0 and ammo == 0 and distance == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

    # Shoot one zombie
    shot += 1

    if shot == zombies:
        return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."

    # Check if out of ammo
    if ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

    # Move remaining zombies closer
    distance -= 0.5

    # Check if zombies reach 0 distance
    if distance <= 0:

    # Recursively call the function
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # Shoot one zombie
    shot += 1
    zombies -= 1

    # Check if all zombies are shot
    if zombies == 0:
        return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."

    # Check if there is no more ammo
    if ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

    # Move all remaining zombies
    distance -= 0.5

    # Check if any zombie reached 0 distance
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

    # Recurse for next second
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo-1, shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # While there are still zombies and ammo left
    while zombies > 0 and ammo > 0:
        # Shoot one zombie
        zombies -= 1
        # Decrease the distance by 0.5 meters
        distance -= 0.5
        # Increase the shot counter by 1
        shot += 1
    # If all zombies are shot
    if zombies == 0:
        return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."
    # If there are still zombies and no ammo left
    elif zombies > 0 and ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
    # If there are no zombies left and ammo is still available
    elif zombies == 0 and ammo > 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    # If there are still zombies and no ammo left, but distance is 0
    elif zombies > 0 and ammo == 0 and distance == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # Calculate the number of seconds it will take for the zombies to reach 0 meters
    seconds = distance / 0.5

    # Check if there is enough ammo to shoot all the zombies
    if ammo >= zombies:
        return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."

    # Check if there is enough ammo to shoot the zombies before they reach 0 meters
    if ammo >= seconds:
        return f"You shot {int(seconds)} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

    # Check if there is enough ammo to shoot some zombies before running out of ammo
    if ammo > 0:
        return f"You shot {ammo} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

    # If there is no ammo, return the appropriate message
    return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):

    while distance > 0 and ammo > 0:

        # shoot one zombie
        distance -= 0.5
        ammo -= 1
        shot += 1

        # move the remaining zombies
        distance -= 0.5 * min(zombies, ammo)

        # update the number of zombies
        zombies -= ammo

    if distance <= 0 and ammo >= 0:
        return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."
    elif distance > 0 and ammo <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
    elif distance <= 0 and ammo < 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

    return

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # Calculate the number of seconds it will take for the zombies to reach 0 meters
    seconds = distance / 0.5

    # Check if there is enough ammo to shoot all the zombies
    if ammo >= zombies:
        return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."

    # Check if there is enough ammo to shoot the zombies before they reach 0 meters
    if ammo >= seconds:
        return f"You shot {int(seconds)} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

    # Check if there is enough ammo to shoot some of the zombies
    if ammo > 0:
        return f"You shot {ammo} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

    # If no ammo, return that you were eaten
    return "You were eaten."
